name: Viceroy Miami

reviews.text: I have to say, this is possibly the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at in the U.S. My friend and I were able to afford this hotel because they had a special where the 3rd night was free. We also decided to upgrade to a nicer room for $9 a night which was a great deal. There was a long hallway leading into our room and we had a corner room so it was quite spacious. We had a nice view of palm trees and a balcony that overlooked the street. Brian at the front desk was most helpful with recommending restaurants to visit in Brickell and South Beach. The beds were very comfortable and we had no problems sleeping. The hotel is situated between South Beach and Virginia Key/Coral Gables, so it's a good location if you want to visit both. There were many nice touches such as the huge towels and the high quality toiletries which come in large bottles and cut down on waste. The pool on the 15th floor is quite memorable and it's worth lounging at and getting a drink. Club 50 has spectacular views and drink specials are good on certain nights if you go early. It was also a nice touch that you can use a laptop in the lobby for free. The staff are superb and the room is gorgeous and feels like a high class apartment. However, if you are traveling with your girlfriend, you must be comfortable with the open bathroom layout (the toilet has a door at least)! I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I am in Miami.
reviews.title: Classy and Beautiful

reviews.text: Best of the best in Miami. We stayed at the Epic and at the Viceroy. The Viceroy is just perfect under every point of view, loved the pool and the Condo (great bathroom). The girl at the front desk, Trish, was charming and very nice.
reviews.title: Oh my, Oh my.

reviews.text: This was my 3rd stay at this hotel this year always on business trips. So far I have enjoyed it very much but this last time I was able to explore the hotel a little bit more. The place is extremely well done, the Gym-SPA is very good and staff is very helpful. Also there are three different outdoor pools one with hot water which was surprising taking into consideration that Miami weather is typically hot (although last week was a little cold for Miami standards). The restaurant on the 15 floor is also good and the staff there very helpful. If you are traveling through Miami and want a nice place for a good price this is the moment to go since this hotel will not remain at this low prices for long. Once the economy rebounds this will be a very pricey location. One annoying thing was that the rooms are all with free WIFI and the hotel gives guests free laptops to use but something happened since my first stay back in January and now you have to use the laptop in the lobby which is not very helpful if you need to work. This should be corrected, I usually do not travel with my laptop to avoid airport security problems so having a courtesy laptop is high on my list but then only providing it for lobby use is not very business friendly. Apart from that, I highly rate this hotel.
reviews.title: Top spot, needs some adjustments, great value right now

reviews.text: My partner and our 2 teenage children vacationed for 6 nights at the Viceroy Miami. Although we typically stay on South Beach when vacationing in Miami, this time it was time for a change. As one of the dads, I wanted a 6 days of sun, service, and relaxation in a first rate resort in downtown Miami. This was our first visit to the Viceroy. The representatives at the front desk welcomed us with smiles (and as if we were the first guests ever to visit the hotel - keep in mind, we travel often and work in customer service for fortune 500 companies.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service - Always with a Smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the phenomal rate our 2 rooms (one for the kids and one for the adults), the rooms were spectacular - marble, flat screen TV, large shower, double vanity, and luxurious bed (could have slept all day). We had to leave the room to lounge by the specatcular infinity pool overlooking Byscayne Bay. After enjoying an amazing tme each morning at the Spa/Fitness Center (who couldn't workout with glass windows overlooking Byscayne Bay?) This was my ritual every morning for 6 days - away at 8, work out til 10, eat a few prunes and drink the cranberry juiice at the spa (think they were telling us something?), shower, then head to the pool for sun and swimming (with almost no one in this massive pool). At 11:30am the kids and my partner arrived for a brief swim before it was time for food at the hotels bistro/e - the service was beyond excellent and the food was outstanding - coming from DC, the decor was refreshing and relaxing. We are really food snobs (just to ourselves) - the food here was fantastic.
reviews.title: From the front door "ahhh"

reviews.text: My friends and I went to see their "Pool" cuz our tour guide pointed it out on our visit on the 20th of August, so we plan on visiting the next morning. We called and asked them if we can use their pool without being a guest at their hotel then they said yes as long as we pay for the day pass.We were exploring and visiting Miami so why not then we paid and got there, had breakfast, changed and jumped in the pool. Memory was part of our vacation so we took lots of pictures plus we were 3 girls. After a while (while we were swimming)a security guard came and asked us if we were guests, We said nope, we paid for the day pass just for the pool then he asked for a receipt (How embarrassing is that to be piked out of 150 people and to be asked for a receipt?)and of course 3 of us were the only black ( I try not to think it that way but it is what it is). We felt so discriminated and everyone around us were wondering what we did. We said we wanted to talk to the manager and told them they need to work on their communication skills between managers and workers before coming straight to the guests and accusing us.I literally cried cuz I was embarrassed and I love my Pride. The worst part of it was they neither called or emailed us to apologize after they took our contact info!! So shameful! I have such a bad memory of that hotel and if there was a negative rating I would love to give it one!
reviews.title: Discrimination @ this HOTEL!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Viceroy was a great experience and I would encourage anybody who has the chance to stay there to do so. The hotel is beautiful, the service is great, and the amenities are outstanding. I am going to make it a point to revisit the Viceroy again enjoy it all over...
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.text: A friend on his first visit to Miami wanted to stay in South Beach. I suggested he shelve that idea for Labor Day weekend and instead stay at the Viceroy, in the hip Brickell District. It's close to great nightlife, public transit (?!), a newly revitalized downtown and just a $22 cab ride from the beaches and craziness of SoBe.
reviews.title: Vegas Style, Miami Sizzle
My Birthday was Ruined, don't stay here if you want yours ruined too!
reviews.text: The decision proved to be the right one. The rooms are spectacular - reminiscent of Aria in Las Vegas. New, sleek and roomy. However, there was a small problem. The original room had a problem with the AC and a chunk of plaster fell on my friend's head. After calling the bell desk, we were promptly moved -- to a luxurious furnished two-bedroom apartment in the Condo tower for Viceroy. AWESOME! Great views, wonderful furnishings, top-notch amenities.

The pool desk is very Vegas-like, minus the annoying hip-hop music bleeding from an adult pool. It's relaxing, yet has a great social atmosphere. The east end of the pool deck has an amazing tanning area with views of Key Biscayne and Brickell Key. There is food service, and the service is just like Vegas -- slightly pricy and very slow.
reviews.title: Absolutely Incredible is an understatement!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel exceeded our expectations. Staff was always courteous, friendly and catered to our every need. The rooms are FANTASTIC!!! We stayed in a suite and it was beautiful, spacious, you couldn't ask for more! Pool was amazing...I've heard that it's the biggest pool in Florida. They have a HUGE jacuzzi--our favorite! Dinner at EOS was great as well. Staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Bar server Albert, as the best!!! and the drinks was awesome! be sure to ask for him! Club 50 was a great place to go to after dinner. The Miami skyline from the 50th floor is breathtaking! Overall, we had a wonderful stay and will definately be back! Two thumbs up!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Fabulous Time, Will Stay Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the Viceroy and loved it. The room was clean and spacious, especially the bathroom! The room came with a balcony and a kitchenette. Dishes and silverware were provided, but there was no pans to use on the electric stove. How are we supposed to use the stove if we wanted to? The beds were extremely comfortable, and it was difficult getting up every morning. The 15th floor pool was amazing! However, there is some construction going on at the end of the balcony, so you can't sit and relax and enjoy the view of the ocean.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay and Convenient Location

reviews.text: Valet parking is $30/night with no option of self-parking. We did find a cheaper option by parking on the street at metered spaces across Brickell Ave. Metered parking has a 3 hour limit but there is the option of paying by phone, which alerts you via text when your time has expired. We found that this cut our parking fees in half.
reviews.title: Great property, Poor service.

reviews.text: The location was convenient. It is about a 15 minute drive to South Beach and there is a People Mover station a block away on 5th Street, which we took to attend a Heats game at AA Arena.
reviews.title: Fantastic service - Beautiful spa - Amazing hotel

reviews.text: Service was great. The front desk greeted us everytime we walked in and out of the hotel, and they followed up on any requests we had. They did say we had access to Club50 right next door, but we did not have time for clubbing on this trip.
reviews.title: great hotel, superb views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are huge, views are great, the bathrooms are immaculate. The pool and the patio areas outside are absolutely phenomenal. All of the amenities and a great service staff are there to cater to your every need with a smile, but are not in your face the entire time clamouring for tips and such. We had the breakfast buffet, which isn't really a buffet in a traditional sense (you are brought your food, but can re-order as much as you want) and were ecstatic - the pastries are great, the granola's wonderful, all of the juices are freshly squeezed, bla bla bla - absolutely awesome.
reviews.title: Royal. Adore This Hotel.

reviews.text: I'm a die hard New Yorker and this hotel and the surrounding condo units are making me consider Miami as a viable living option.
reviews.title: A fantastic stay!

reviews.text: The Viceroy is a gorgeous hotel where they know how to treat their guests. Everything was fantastic about my stay, from the mini-kitchenette where I was able to keep my own food for snacks and breakfast, the insanely large bathroom with great water pressure, beautiful views of the water, I could go on and on. Fantastic fitness center as well with a great variety of equipment. Also - they offer free wireless internet in the rooms, which just makes sense in today's day and age. Nothing is more annoying than a ridiculous charge by a hotel to access the internet. My only complaints would be the valet service can sometimes be slow - I called 10 minutes prior to going downstairs one morning, and still waited another 10 minutes before my car was brought around; and the only way to the fitness center is to go outside to the 15th level, walk across the pool deck into the other building and go down an elevator. A little ridiculous, and would really suck in bad weather. And a suggestion, unless I missed it, it would be nice to have somewhere to pick up a cup of coffee "to go" in the AM - you need a Ph.D. to work the cappuccino machine in the guest rooms. Overall, this was a fantastic hotel and I will be back.
reviews.title: A superb hotel with an excellent staff

reviews.text: I stayed at the Viceroy for two weeks on a business trip. The Viceroy far exceeded my expectations. The entire staff was wonderful. They are friendly, helpful, and always taking care of their guests. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated. The views from my corner room were of the bay and the financial district. The pools and tanning areas are awesome. I found the view from the infinity pool looking out over the bay was most relaxing. The fitness center was spacious and well equipped, and it too had a beautiful view of the water. The spa was a special treat and a great place to unwind. At the end of my two weeks, I only wished it had been a longer stay (without the business part)!
reviews.title: Most relaxing vacation.

reviews.text: The Viceroy is truly a beautiful hotel. It has great amenities, including a beautiful spa and the largest infinity pool in Florida. The rooms are beautiful and hi-tech. And overall, I had an amazing vacation.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great location with great views.
reviews.title: WOW! Best hotel we have ever stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went with my wife to celebrate our anniversary (without the kids) and we were really happy to find this place. Top-notch service throughout the property, not to mention that it's gorgeous - beautiful things everywhere - really high-end design wherever you look, almost as though it was "staged" to perfection. Yet even with the very cool, hip and blisteringly expensive vibe going on, it was still very comfortable, and although we have our own kids, we were selfishly happy NOT to see a ton of kids there - especially with spring break going on locally. Mind you, though, the hotel is part of a condo complex (The Icon - three 50 story towers) which although completed, was 99% unoccupied (typical now-a-days in South Florida), but once it fills up (which in the current economic climate could take years...) the incredible peace and quiet that we found throughout the property will likely (and sadly) dissipate to some degree.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But for now, our room was nice. We had a 1 bed/2 bath suite. Great AC, spotless throughout, mainly a city view (although you could see the water also) and although there was no furniture on the balcony, we were very-well provided for inside, so we didnt care. Comforable beds, large marble-covered bathrooms, and even a small kitchen-ette complete with cook-top, microwave, sink and espresso maker. Overall, very comfortable, clean and pleasing to the eye.
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel !!!

reviews.text: The pool areas on floors 15 and 50 were both beautiful - and the private club way up on 50 was Vegas/SoBe cool - but my favorite part of the hotel - by far - was the spa. Holy moly it's gorgeous! For gym/spa freaks, you really have to see it to appreciate it...and the staff there can't do enough for you; the trainer was totally game to help me out in the gym, which had tons of cardio machines and was loaded with both free weights and top-of-the-line Technogym machines. I did a spin class also. Good instructor, and he played some really cool house music from this incredible sound system, which made the 1 hour class fly by. Locker room w/ steam, sauna, and, again, marble everywhere. Overally, an incredible facility - so much more beautiful than any spa I've ever been too, not to mention, again, that it was empty, which made it than much quieter. Didn't get any spa treatments, not so much because of the astronomical prices, but more so because I was relaxed enough without it.
reviews.title: All Time Favorite Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only area that we thought could be improved was in the food (taste - not service) dept - lunches were good, dinner good but not great, and room svc breakfast was "eh" at best. We were told that the hotel is bringing in a michelin-starred chef within the next few weeks - and if he's worth his "star", then that could the proverbial icing on the cake...
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd definately return. Enjoy the "introductory" rates while they last, because I have a feeling that once word gets out about this place, they are undoubtedly going to shoot up.
reviews.title: Still not fully functional

description: Viceroy Miami blends timeless East Asian accents, international service standards and Miami's own rich ambience to create an unparalleled resort destination in Brickell, Miami's Wall Street of the Americas.Created for discerning globetrotters,this luxury resort in Miami offers 148 residentially appointed guestrooms, suites and one- and two-bedroom residences (which include fully equipped kitchenettes or full kitchens), custom-designed Sferra linens and more non-negotiable indulgences for a truly exceptional Miami resort experience.From cocktails and small plates served poolside on the 50th floor, to the chef's tasting menu at the signature restaurant and terrace overlooking the pool deck, to round-the-clock guestroom dining, Viceroy Miami satisfies every culinary craving.Located at the northern gateway to Brickell Avenue, Viceroy Miami is ideally situated to cater to the business elite. This Miami boutique hotel is also centrally located near the city's many distinctive neighborhoods, cultural institutions, sporting venues and area attractions.Within Icon Brickell, the hotel stands steps from the 28,000-square-foot spa and fitness center, 300-foot infinity pool on Biscayne Bay, poolside bar and fireplace, and life-size chess set. Perched atop the 50th floor of Viceroy Miami, FIFTY Ultra Lounge offers the city's most exclusive lounge, while the private pool deck with bar offers dramatic skyline views unequalled in Miami.At Viceroy Miami, set the stage bayside and park-side for a business meeting, press event, photo shoot, sales presentation, conference or product launch. Versatile function spaces — ranging from traditional meeting rooms to the signature restaurant, rooftop lounge, and The Viceroy Spa Miami—make Viceroy Miami an ideal location for any gathering or meeting.The hotel also offers comprehensive catering services for every event from weddings to bar mitzvahs - including innovative culinary concepts and event planners that can assist you with all your event needs from décor, design, audio/visual or media.
